concise_definition: n. 胡椒, 辣椒; v. 撒上胡椒, 密集分布

definitions.explanation_en: A pungent spice made from the dried berries of the Piper nigrum plant, commonly used to season food; can refer to black, white, green, or red pepper.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种由胡椒植物（Piper nigrum）干燥浆果制成的辛辣香料，常用于调味食物；可指黑胡椒、白胡椒、青胡椒或红胡椒。
definitions.example_en: She added a pinch of black pepper to the soup for extra flavor.
definitions.example_cn: 她往汤里撒了一小撮黑胡椒以增添风味。

definitions.explanation_en: A fruit or vegetable from the Capsicum genus, typically spicy or sweet, used in cooking; commonly known as bell pepper or chili pepper.
definitions.explanation_cn: 茄科辣椒属植物的果实，通常味道辛辣或甜味，常用于烹饪；俗称甜椒或辣椒。
definitions.example_en: He chopped up some red peppers and added them to the stir-fry.
definitions.example_cn: 他切了一些红辣椒，加入炒菜中。

definitions.explanation_en: To sprinkle or scatter something, especially small objects or elements, over a surface or area in a random or dense pattern.
definitions.explanation_cn: 将某物（尤指小物件或元素）随机或密集地撒布在表面或区域上。
definitions.example_en: The field was peppered with bullet holes after the shootout.
definitions.example_cn: 枪战过后，这片田野上布满了弹孔。

definitions.explanation_en: To season food with pepper, especially black pepper, to enhance its flavor.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用胡椒（尤指黑胡椒）给食物调味，以增强其风味。
definitions.example_en: Don't forget to pepper the steak before grilling it.
definitions.example_cn: 烤牛排前别忘了撒上胡椒。

comparison.analysis: “Spice”（香料）是更广泛的类别，泛指所有用于调味的植物性物质，如肉桂、姜、丁香等。而 “pepper” 是一种具体的香料，特指胡椒类，是 spice 的子集。所有 pepper 都是 spice，但并非所有 spice 都是 pepper。
“Sprinkle”（撒）强调轻柔、均匀地散布少量物质，常用于糖、盐、面粉等，语气较温和。而 “pepper” 作为动词时，暗示密集、随机、甚至杂乱的散布，常用于负面或强烈语境，如弹孔、问题、批评等，带有更强的视觉冲击力。
“Dot”（点状分布）指零星、稀疏、有间隔地分布，如地图上的点或星星点点的灯光。而 “pepper” 指密集、连续、几乎覆盖式的分布，数量远多于 “dot”，更强调数量和无规律性。
